Expected Competancy.Title: Strategic Leadership & Ownership
Competencies: Demonstrate accountability for cross-functional deliverables.
Act as a cultural ambassador promoting engineering excellence.
Drive initiatives that enhance team morale and productivity.
Handle ambiguity with clarity and structured decision-making.
Mentor and coach future engineering leaders.

Expected Competancy.Title: Continuous Learning & Growth
Competencies: Stay updated on emerging architectural trends and practices.
Engage in external technical forums, publications, or speaking events.
Develop cross-domain expertise beyond core specialization.
Seek feedback from peers and leadership for continuous growth.
Lead knowledge-sharing sessions within and outside the team.

Expected Competancy.Title: Architecture & Design
Competencies: Define and enforce engineering architecture principles.
Design scalable, secure, and high-performance solutions.
Evaluate and introduce emerging technologies to solve business challenges.
Drive standardization of tools, processes, and best practices.
Ensure designs meet compliance and security standards.

Expected Competancy.Title: Technical Excellence
Competencies: Guide teams on complex technical problem solving.
Review critical code and system implementations.
Optimize development processes for efficiency and quality.
Lead incident management and root cause analysis.
Influence technical roadmaps across multiple teams.

Expected Competancy.Title: Product Strategy Alignment
Competencies: Translate business objectives into technical strategies.
Collaborate with product leaders on long-term vision.
Anticipate market needs and design forward-compatible solutions.
Balance short-term delivery and long-term sustainability.
Influence prioritization based on business impact.

Expected Competancy.Title: Customer-Centric Engineering
Competencies: Embed customer feedback loops in solution design.
Advocate for usability and performance improvements.
Analyze product usage patterns to guide engineering focus.
Promote experimentation for user-driven innovation.
Champion high availability and resilience goals.

Expected Competancy.Title: Industry & Competitive Awareness
Competencies: Benchmark architecture against industry leaders.
Monitor competitor technology stacks and trends.
Assess potential disruptions and emerging opportunities.
Publish whitepapers or thought leadership content.
Engage with external partners and research bodies.

Expected Competancy.Title: Technology Evangelism
Competencies: Represent the company at technology forums and events.
Advocate engineering achievements internally and externally.
Build external relationships with tech communities.
Contribute to open-source or industry consortiums.
Promote a culture of innovation within engineering.
